about.name: London
about.info_text: London, the capital of the United Kingdom, is a dynamic and diverse metropolis known for its rich history, iconic landmarks, and cultural vibrancy. Situated on the River Thames, the city is a global hub for finance, fashion, and the arts. Visitors can explore historic sites like the Tower of London, Buckingham Palace, and Westminster Abbey. London is also famous for its world-class museums, theaters, and vibrant neighborhoods. With a diverse culinary scene and an array of international influences, it's a city that offers something for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 8.8 million
Region: Greater London
Time Zone: Greenwich Mean Time (UTC+00:00)
Language: English
Currency: British Pound (GBP)
about.climate_text: London has a temperate maritime climate with mild temperatures and moderate rainfall throughout the year. Summers are generally warm, and winters are cool with occasional snowfall.

attractions_card.title: Tower Bridge
attractions_card.description: Tower Bridge is an iconic bascule and suspension bridge known for its striking architecture and the glass-floored walkway with views of the River Thames.

attractions_card.title: Buckingham Palace
attractions_card.description: Buckingham Palace is the official residence of the British monarch and a must-visit landmark, especially during the Changing of the Guard ceremony.

attractions_card.title: British Museum
attractions_card.description: The British Museum is home to a vast collection of art and artifacts from around the world, including the Rosetta Stone and the Elgin Marbles.

attractions_card.title: Westminster Abbey
attractions_card.description: Westminster Abbey is a historic Gothic church where many British monarchs have been crowned, and it also serves as a mausoleum for notable figures.

attractions_card.title: The Shard
attractions_card.description: The Shard is London's tallest skyscraper, offering panoramic views of the city from its observation deck, as well as dining and entertainment options.

attractions_card.title: Tate Modern
attractions_card.description: Tate Modern is a contemporary art museum housed in a former power station, featuring an impressive collection of modern and contemporary art.

attractions_card.title: Notting Hill
attractions_card.description: Notting Hill is a trendy and colorful neighborhood famous for the Portobello Road Market, vibrant houses, and the Notting Hill Carnival.

attractions_card.title: Theatre District
attractions_card.description: London's Theatre District, including the West End, is renowned for its world-class theaters and performances, making it a hub for the arts and entertainment.

food_card.title: Fish and Chips
food_card.description: Fish and chips is a classic British dish featuring battered and fried fish served with thick-cut potatoes and often accompanied by mushy peas and tartar sauce.

food_card.title: Full English Breakfast
food_card.description: The Full English Breakfast is a hearty morning meal that typically includes eggs, bacon, sausages, baked beans, mushrooms, tomatoes, and toast.

food_card.title: Afternoon Tea
food_card.description: Afternoon tea is a quintessential British tradition, featuring a selection of teas, finger sandwiches, scones with clotted cream and jam, and assorted pastries.

food_card.title: Curry
food_card.description: London is known for its diverse culinary scene, and you can savor excellent Indian and South Asian curries in various restaurants around the city.

food_card.title: Pies and Pastries
food_card.description: British pies and pastries, including steak and kidney pie, chicken pie, and Cornish pasties, are comfort foods enjoyed in London.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz London
hotels_card.description: The Ritz London is an iconic luxury hotel renowned for its opulent decor, afternoon tea, and world-class service in the heart of Mayfair.

hotels_card.title: The Savoy
hotels_card.description: The Savoy is a historic and elegant hotel located on the Strand, offering luxurious accommodations, fine dining, and the famous American Bar.

hotels_card.title: Shangri-La Hotel, At The Shard
hotels_card.description: Shangri-La Hotel, At The Shard, is a luxury hotel situated within the iconic Shard skyscraper, providing breathtaking views of the city.

hotels_card.title: The Langham, London
hotels_card.description: The Langham, London, is a stylish and sophisticated hotel near Regent's Park, offering classic luxury and modern amenities.

transport_card.title: Heathrow Airport
transport_card.description: Heathrow Airport is one of the busiest international airports, connecting London to destinations worldwide.

transport_card.title: London Underground
transport_card.description: The London Underground, also known as the Tube, is an extensive and efficient subway system that provides easy access to various parts of the city.

transport_card.title: London Buses
transport_card.description: London's red double-decker buses are a familiar sight and offer a convenient way to travel around the city, with an extensive bus network.

transport_card.title: Black Cabs
transport_card.description: London's black cabs, or Hackney carriages, are iconic and reliable taxis that can be hailed on the street or found at designated taxi ranks.

transport_card.title: Bike Rentals
transport_card.description: London promotes cycling, and you can rent bikes to explore the city's streets and dedicated cycling paths.
